item.description: While the SVG format gives us a way to morph between two paths with the same number of points using `<animate>`, we can use a few tricks to morph between arbitrary paths too!

item.title: I was wrong about "agile" software development
item.description: Way back in 2004, I did a short contract job with a certain major insurance company. It was starting the process of getting out of the old mainframe world. To help with this, they brought in a certain well-known consulting company to coach Agile software development. I capitalize it because they do, to this day, and when I use it this way, I'm referring to the more formalized process. But it isn't the same thing as being agile, which to me means that you move quickly, with focus on delivering stuff. These folks introduced me to a lot of formalized stuff like use cases, user stories, sprints and stand-ups.

item.title: Scraping thousands of temporary (disposable) phone numbers
item.description: Temporary phone numbers are virtual numbers used for a short period, allowing users to receive calls and messages without revealing their personal number. In this article we create a scraper to download more than 5,000 temporary numbers and 393K messages they received.

item.title: AlphaFold opens new opportunities for Folding@home – Folding@home
item.description: Folding@home has long sought to understand how proteins self-assemble, or fold, into their functional structures and what the functional implications of dynamics within the context of a folded protein are. As such, many may wonder what it means for the project when they hear that a new software algorithm called AlphaFold has “solved” the protein folding problem.
item.author: (by Greg Bowman)
